views.markdown:
Fix memory leak on preference change - Fixed potential crashes of processes that use UIKit but are not applications
- Fixed SpringBoard crashes for iOS 9.0.x


- Added "Display Icon Labels" which adds a label underneath the icon inside the button
- Added ability to modify button size
- Added ability to modify the roundness of the button
- New Activator Action "Control Window"
- Added whitelist to disable button in specific applications
- Added option to disable button on homescreen
- Added "Alternative Mode" for applications where the regular rotation is not detected sometimes (split view applications)
- Fixed preferences not registering in sand-boxed applications
- Added "Unlock Orientation Lock" when changing views
- Fixed random button invoking the undo button action
- Added 7 activator actions (if you have activator installed, does not depend on it)
- Added option to configure button opacity
- Added option to select button position
- Fixed what I broke in 0.0.3 and 0.0.4 trying to be cool (so tweak works again in safari and other applications)

- Removed Debug Mode
- Fixed Display Seconds to not round down anymore
- Added "Current Orientation"
- Fixed safe mode crash on attempting to display button on anything other than homescreen and applications (that should be all the crashes I believe)

- Added Undo "Undo Rotation" to undo the last undo that you did
- Added Debug Mode Switch to preferences
- Partial Fix for crashes to safe mode (not fully fixed yet, mostly because I am unable to recreate it, please enable debug mode and send me the crash report)

- Added option to configure the amount of seconds the button is displayed for
- Fixed button sometime not displaying inside applications
- Fixed potential crash to safe mode
